channel.title: NPR All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Ari Shapiro, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.

item.title: UNAIDS report warns HIV progress at risk as U.S. funding cuts take hold
item.description: The UNAIDS annual report warns that Trump era HIV funding cuts could lead to 6 million more infections and 4 million deaths by 2029 — as low-income countries struggle to fill the gap.

item.title: How climate change is affecting prized tea-growing regions in China and Taiwan
item.description: Changing weather patterns and higher temperatures are affecting some of the most prized tea-growing regions in China and Taiwan.

item.title: This week in science: a comet, plastic-eating bugs, and how altitude changes smell
item.description: Emily Kwong and Regina Barber of NPR's Short Wave talk about a comet visiting from interstellar space, caterpillars that eat and break down plastic, and how animals' sense of smell varies by altitude.

item.title: Pope Leo XIV calls on Catholics to see the urgency of protecting the environment
item.description: The Vatican has released a new liturgy for the Mass reflecting concern for the environment, offering prayers, readings and hymns that highlight the church's responsibility to protect the Earth.

item.title: Brazil's Lula warns of 50% tariffs on U.S. goods after Trump trade threat
item.description: Brazil's President Lula is firing back at Trump's 50% tariff threat — saying Brazil is ready to match any U.S. import taxes, dollar for dollar.

item.title: ICE crackdowns are making some fear showing up for work
item.description: The Trump administration's crackdowns on immigrants is causing a profound change in the labor force right now. Today on the show: are immigrants still showing up for work?

item.title: James Gunn's 'Superman' movie is corny. Which is why it gets Superman right
item.description: Every era gets the Superman it needs. James Gunn's version — sincere, inspiring and idealistic — will make you want to cheer.

item.title: What Musk's third party could mean for Trump and his support inside the 'manosphere'
item.description: With his eyes on the midterms, Elon Musk says he's starting a new political party. It's a move that could appeal to a key group Trump made gains with last fall: young voters, particularly young men.

item.title: DOGE has special access to sensitive financial data on millions of farmers
item.description: DOGE recently got high-level access to a database that controls billions of dollars in government payments to farmers and ranchers across the U.S.

item.title: Mark Snow, who composed the music for TV shows like 'The X-Files,' has died at 78
item.description: The composer Mark Snow has died at 78 years old. He did the music for many TV shows, including The X-Files, Smallville and Blue Bloods.
